subject: Business
title: Lifelong Learning as a Leader
description: A quick, practical guide to Lifelong Learning as a Leader.

hook.text: Bill Gates reads 50 books a year. Warren Buffett reads 500 pages a day. The most successful leaders never stop learning.

buildup.text: Knowledge has a half-life. What made you successful five years ago may be obsolete today.

discovery.text: Leaders who stop learning become rigid. They apply yesterday's solutions to tomorrow's problems.

twist.text: Learning for leaders isn't just reading. It's seeking feedback, experimenting, and staying curious about unfamiliar.

climax.text: Satya Nadella made 'learn-it-all' the cultural norm at Microsoft, replacing the old 'know-it-all' mentality.

punchline.text: The day you stop learning is the day you stop leading.

quiz.question: Why is lifelong learning critical for leaders?
options: Knowledge becomes obsolete and yesterday's solutions don't solve tomorrow's problems
Leaders are required to earn continuing education credits
Reading makes leaders appear more intelligent to their teams
